conclusion: Cart A is moving to the left with speed \( v_1 \), Cart B is moving to the right with speed \( v_2 \), and the bullet is fired from Cart A with speed \( v_0 \).
Cart A is equipped with a gun that fires bullets horizontally. Cart B has a target mounted on it. The bullet travels horizontally from Cart A to Cart B.

The bullet hits the target on Cart B when the next bullet has already been fired. The speeds of the carts are not affected by the firing of the bullets. The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is \( s \).

premise: The bullet travels a distance \( s \) horizontally before hitting the target on Cart B.
conclusion: The displacement of the bullet relative to the ground is \( s \).

premise: The displacement of Cart B relative to the ground is \( s_2 \).
conclusion: The displacement of Cart B is equal to the displacement of the bullet because the bullet hits the target when the next bullet has already been fired.

premise: The displacement of the bullet \( s \) is equal to the displacement of the car \( s_2 \).
conclusion: The displacement of the bullet \( s \) is equal to \( s_2 \).

premise: The time interval between shots is \( \Delta t_0 \), and the distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is \( s \).
conclusion: The total distance traveled by the bullet in time \( \Delta t_0 \) is \( s = (v_0 + v_1) \Delta t_0 \).
